The second one is confirmation bias, which indicates that when exposed to information in the same direction, individuals tend to update their beliefs. However, when exposure to information in the opposite direction, the changes in beliefs are not significant. We are conducting a lab experiment to investigate our research questions instead of revealing the post beliefs after the shock, we review the initial beliefs and measure the post belief using an action to dominate an organization combating climate change.
